Description: DEVELOP AN INNOVATIVE PROGRAM FOR COLLABORATIVE ARCHAEOLOGICAL ORIENTATION AND INTEGRATION RELATING TO RESOLVED AND UNRESOLVED CASUALTY CASES, BATTLES, AND OTHER CONFLICT-RELATED EVENTS, TO INCLUDE ARCHIVAL RESEARCH, PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SOURCE ANALYSIS, ORAL HISTORY INTERVIEWS, TRANSCRIPTION AND TRANSLATION PROJECTS, GEOSPATIAL OR GIS ANALYSES, AND ANY OTHER PERTINENT ASSESSMENTS DESIGNED TO ASSSIST DPAA WITH ACCOUNTING FOR MISSING MILITARY PERSONNEL FROM PAST CONFLICTS.

DEVELOP A PROGRAM TO FIND INNOVATIVE APPROACHES FOR SYSTEMATIC COMPARATIVE ARCHAEOLOGICAL STUDIES OF PROJECTS RELATING TO UNRESOLVED CASUALTY CASES AND OTHER RELATED EVENTS, TO INCLUDE DIGITAL ORGANIZATION, ARCHIVAL RESEARCH, DIGITIZATION AND DATA CHARACTERIZATION PROJECTS, GEOSPATIAL OR GIS ANALYSES, AND ANY OTHER ASSESSMENTS DESIGNED TO ASSSIST IN ACHIEVING THE FULLEST POSSIBLE ACCOUNTING FOR MISSING PERSONNEL FROM PAST CONFLICTS.
DEVELOP A PROGRAM TO PROVIDE INNOVATIVE NEW APPROACHES FOR CONDUCTING SYSTEMATIC INTERDISCIPLINARY HISTORICALLY-BASED RESEARCH AND ANALYSES RELATING TO UNRESOLVED CASUALTY CASES.

DEVELOP AN INNOVATIVE PROGRAM FOR COLLABORATIVE ARCHAEOLOGICAL ORIENTATION AND INTEGRATION RELATING TO RESOLVED AND UNRESOLVED CASUALTY CASES AND OTHER CONFLICT-RELATED EVENTS TO INCLUDE IDENTIFYING NEW APPROACHES TO ARCHIVAL RESEARCH TO SUPPORT THE DPAA MISSION TO ACCOUNT FOR MISSING MILITARY PERSONNEL LOST IN PAST CONFLICTS SUCH AS DEVELOPING INNOVATIVE TOOLS TO ASSIST WITH THE ANALYSIS OF PERTINENT RECORDS AND DATA AND FINDING CREATIVE SOURCES AND METHODOLOGIES FOR EXPANDING HISTORICAL RESEARCH THROUTH THE USE OF DATA ANALYTICS AND OTHER APPROACHES

DEVELOP AN INNOVATIVE PROGRAM FOR COLLABORATIVE ARCHAEOLOGICAL ORIENTATION AND INTEGRATION RELATING TO RESOLVED AND UNRESOLVED CASUALTY CASES, BATTLES, AND OTHER CONFLICT-RELATED EVENTS, TO INCLUDE ARCHIVAL RESEARCH, PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SOURCE ANALYSIS, ORAL HISTORY INTERVIEWS, TRANSCRIPTION AND TRANSLATION PROJECTS, GEOSPATIAL OR GIS ANALYSES, AND ANY OTHER PERTINENT ASSESSMENTS DESIGNED TO ASSSIST DPAA WITH ACCOUNTING FOR MISSING MILITARY PERSONNEL FROM PAST CONFLICTS.

RECIPIENT PROVIDES EXPERT, INNOVATIVE, AND RESPONSIVE OPERATIONAL SUPPORT OF DPAA EFFORTS TO LOCATE,RECOVER, AND IDENTIFY THE REMAINS OF UNACCOUNTED FOR DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE DOD PERSONNEL FROM DESIGNATED PAST CONFLICTS. DPAA MISSION INVOLVES HISTORICAL RESEARCH, ARCHAEOLOGY,FORENSIC ANTHROPOLOGY,LABORATORY ANALYSES,AND OTHER RELATED ACTIVITIES
THIS IS A SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT TO DPAA'S AWARD HQ07611820001. SUPPORT OF THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL DELINEATION OF A WWII -ERA AIRCRAFT CRASH SITE.
